intro: Higginsia argyroneura, commonly known as the silverleaf higginsia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, silver-gray foliage that reflects sunlight, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are clustered in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Higginsia argyroneura is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
